Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
mount_entry
SFont_FontDeclare one variable of this type for each font you are using
T_BMP_Header
T_Brush_templateA single memorized brush from the Brush Container
T_CEL_Header1
T_CEL_Header2
T_Cluster
T_Cluster_set
T_ComponentsA set of RGB values
T_ConfigThis structure holds all the settings saved and loaded as gfx2.ini
T_Config_chunkHeader for a config chunk in for gfx2.cfg. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Config_headerHeader for gfx2.cfg. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Config_shortcut_infoConfiguration for one keyboard shortcut in gfx2.cfg. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Config_video_modeData for one fullscreen video mode in configuration file. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Conversion_table
T_Dropdown_buttonA window control that behaves like a dropdown button
T_Dropdown_choiceData for a dropdown item, ie. one proposed choice
T_FileselectorData for a fileselector
T_Fileselector_itemData for one item (file, directory) in a fileselector
T_Font
T_FormatData for an image file format
T_GIF_IDB
T_GIF_LSDB
T_Gradient
T_Gradient_arrayData for one setting of gradients. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Gradient_set
T_Gui_skinGUI skin data
T_Help_sectionData for one section of the "Help" screens, ie a page
T_Help_tableData for one line of the "Help" screens
T_IMG_Header
T_KCF_Header
T_Key_config
T_LBM_Header
T_List_button
T_List_of_pagesCollection of undo/redo steps
T_Normal_buttonA normal rectangular button in windows and menus
T_Occurrence_table
T_PageThis is the data for one step of Undo/Redo, for one image
T_Palette_buttonA window control that shows a complete 256-color palette
T_PCX_Header
T_PKM_Header
T_Polygon_edge
T_Scroller_buttonA window control that represents a vertical scrollbar, with a slider, and two arrow buttons
T_SCx_Header
T_ShadeData for one setting of shade. Warning, this one is saved/loaded as binary
T_Special_buttonA window control that only has a rectangular "active" area which catches mouse clicks,
T_Video_modeA video mode (resolution) usable by Grafx2
